tr.td: Self-referral to accident and emergency department

td.p: 60 year old man complaining of chest pain lasting around 2 hours.

td.pre:
Full Blood Count
Test Value Units Reference Range White Cell Count 11.1 x10*9/L 3.5 - 10.0 Red Cell Count 5.0 x10*12/L 4.25 - 5.75 Haemoglobin 150 g/L 13.0 - 17.0 Haematocrit 0.230 L/L 0.400 - 0.500 Mean Cell Volume 90 fL 84 - 98 Mean Cell Hb 33.0 pg 27.5 - 32.0 Mean Cell Hb Con 34.0 pg 31.0 - 35.0 RDW 12.0 % < 14.5 Platelet Count 300 x10*9/L 150 - 400
Machine Differential
Test Value Units Reference Range Neutrophils 7.0 x10*9/L 1.7 - 7.5 Lymphocytes 3.5 x10*9/L 1.0 - 3.5 Monocytes 0.3 x10*9/L < 0.6 Eosinophils 0.4 x10*9/L < 0.4 Basophils 0.1 x10*9/L < 0.1 LUCs 0.2 x10*9/L < 0.4

tr.td:
Description of reaction:
Rash. No swelling/anaphylaxis
Uptitrate according to BP and HR

Patient to be admitted to Cramer ward for further tests to investigate causes of his chest pain.
Status: Completed
Streamed from emergency department to urgent care service following initial assessment

text.value: Take one tablet daily as needed
Uptitrate according to BP and HR.
